It was a part of the 2007 football season and was played at [[Reeves Field]] in [[Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania]]. The game placed the [[2007 Malone Pioneers football team|Malone Pioneers]][http://www.cantonrep.com/index.php?ID=385498&Category=17&subCategoryID=30 Canton Repository] "Malone assured of another game" November 8, 2007 against the [[Geneva College Golden Tornadoes Football | Geneva College Golden Tornadoes]].[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/07315/832974-134.stm Pittsburgh Post-Gazzette Sports] "Geneva 13, Grove City 12" Malone won the game by a score of 45 to 17.[http://www.geneva.edu/attach/69354.html?type=support&primitive=0 Geneva College] "Are You Ready?" 2008 Golden Tornadoes football guide A strong showing in the second quarter of 31 points by the Pioneers helped to secure the win[http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/07322/834968-134.stm Pittsburgh Post-Gazette Sports] "Victory Bowl" November 18, 2007 and was assisted by four turnovers.[http://www.cantonrep.com/index.php?ID=387117&Category=17&subCategoryID=30 Canton Repository] "AREA COLLEGE FOOTBALL: MALONE 45, GENEVA 17" November 18, 2007 The game was the second bowl appearance for both the Pioneers and Malone coach [[Mike Gardner (football coach)|Mike Gardner]], as well as the first bowl game victory for both.[http://www.thenccaa.org/victorybowlarc.htm#2007 The National Christian College Athletic Association] 2007 Victory Bowl ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.thenccaa.org/victorybowl.htm Victory Bowl at the NCCAA website] {{Victory Bowl navbox}} [[Category:Victory Bowl]] [[Category:Geneva Golden Tornadoes football bowl games]] [[Category:Malone Pioneers football bowl games]] [[Category:2007 NAIA football season|Victory Bowl]] [[Category:2007 NCAA Division III football season|Victory Bowl]]
